title: ICE in crate matrixmultiply with newest nightly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

body:
Can't compile the crate matrixmultiply (https://crates.io/crates/matrixmultiply)
It seems to not compile anymore since [this commit](https://github.com/bluss/matrixmultiply/commit/44e97218878504575886e9c370870fe0d1debe13).
And the line `assert!(mr * nr * size_of::<K::Elem>() <= 256 && K::align_to() <= 32);` is the cause.

Minimal code to reproduce ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=6aa02fd21b98b65be68c1a6a3fd2e802&version=nightly))
```
use std::mem::size_of;

pub trait GemmKernel {
    type Elem;
}

pub type T = f32;

pub enum Gemm { }

impl GemmKernel for Gemm {
    type Elem = T;
}

fn gemm_packed<K>()
where
    K: GemmKernel,
{
    assert!(size_of::<K::Elem>() <= 256);
}

fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```

My system:
rustc 1.20.0-nightly (582af6e1a 2017-07-19) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 582af6e1ad75c12320e7237ff4361a1ed3514124
commit-date: 2017-07-19
LLVM version: 4.0

Backtrace:
error: internal compiler error: /checkout/src/librustc/infer/mod.rs:573: Encountered errors `[FulfillmentError(Obligation(predicate=Binder(TraitPredicate(<K as kernel::GemmKernel>)),depth=0),Unimplemented)]` resolving bounds after type-checking

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.20.0-nightly (582af6e1a 2017-07-19) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
